ans.reasoning: The addData method is responsible for updating the internal state of the regression model with new data points. If there is an issue with how the sums (sumXX, sumYY, sumXY) are calculated or updated, it could lead to incorrect results in subsequent calculations, such as the sum of squared errors. Given that the test is failing on the assertion related to the sum of squared errors, this method is highly suspicious.

The getSumSquaredErrors method directly computes the sum of squared errors based on the internal state maintained by the addData method. If the data was not added correctly or if the internal state is incorrect, this method will produce incorrect results. Therefore, it is also suspicious, but it relies on the correctness of the addData method.

The constructor method SimpleRegression initializes the object but does not perform any calculations or data manipulations. It is unlikely to be the source of the fault since it does not affect the internal state or calculations directly. Thus, it is the least suspicious.
